trans-unit.source: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine
trans-unit.target: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine

trans-unit.source: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine
trans-unit.target: Using Emulator Express to run and debug a cloud service on a local machine

trans-unit.source: By using Emulator Express, you can test and debug a cloud service without running Visual Studio as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: By using Emulator Express, you can test and debug a cloud service without running Visual Studio as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: You can set your project settings to use either Emulator Express or the full emulator, depending on the requirements of your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can set your project settings to use either Emulator Express or the full emulator, depending on the requirements of your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the full emulator, see [Run an Azure Application in the Compute Emulator](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh403990.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the full emulator, see [Run an Azure Application in the Compute Emulator](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh403990.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Emulator Express was first included in Azure SDK 2.1, and as of Azure SDK 2.3, it is the default emulator.
trans-unit.target: Emulator Express was first included in Azure SDK 2.1, and as of Azure SDK 2.3, it is the default emulator.

trans-unit.source: Using Emulator Express in the Visual Studio IDE
trans-unit.target: Using Emulator Express in the Visual Studio IDE

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project in Azure SDK 2.3 or later, Emulator Express is already selected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project in Azure SDK 2.3 or later, Emulator Express is already selected.

trans-unit.source: For existing projects that were created with an earlier version of the SDK, follow these steps to select Emulator Express.
trans-unit.target: For existing projects that were created with an earlier version of the SDK, follow these steps to select Emulator Express.

trans-unit.source: To configure a project to use Emulator Express
trans-unit.target: To configure a project to use Emulator Express

trans-unit.source: On the shortcut menu for the Azure project, choose **Properties**, and then choose the **Web** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the shortcut menu for the Azure project, choose **Properties**, and then choose the **Web** tab.

trans-unit.source: Under **Local Development Server**, choose the **Use IIS Express option** button.
trans-unit.target: Under **Local Development Server**, choose the **Use IIS Express option** button.

trans-unit.source: Emulator Express isn't compatible with IIS Web Server.
trans-unit.target: Emulator Express isn't compatible with IIS Web Server.

trans-unit.source: Under **Emulator**, choose the **Use Emulator Express** option button.
trans-unit.target: Under **Emulator**, choose the **Use Emulator Express** option button.

trans-unit.source: Emulator Express
trans-unit.target: Emulator Express

trans-unit.source: Launching Emulator Express at a command prompt
trans-unit.target: Launching Emulator Express at a command prompt

trans-unit.source: At a command prompt, you can launch the express version of the Azure Compute Emulator, csrun.exe, by using the /useemulatorexpress option.
trans-unit.target: At a command prompt, you can launch the express version of the Azure Compute Emulator, csrun.exe, by using the /useemulatorexpress option.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: Before you use Emulator Express, you should be aware of some limitations:
trans-unit.target: Before you use Emulator Express, you should be aware of some limitations:

trans-unit.source: Emulator Express isn't compatible with IIS Web Server.
trans-unit.target: Emulator Express isn't compatible with IIS Web Server.

trans-unit.source: Your cloud service can contain multiple roles, but each role is limited to one instance.
trans-unit.target: Your cloud service can contain multiple roles, but each role is limited to one instance.

trans-unit.source: You can't access port numbers below 1000.
trans-unit.target: You can't access port numbers below 1000.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you use an authentication provider that normally uses a port below 1000, you might need to change this value to a port number that's above 1000.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you use an authentication provider that normally uses a port below 1000, you might need to change this value to a port number that's above 1000.

trans-unit.source: Any limitations that apply to the Azure Compute Emulator also apply to Emulator Express.
trans-unit.target: Any limitations that apply to the Azure Compute Emulator also apply to Emulator Express.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can't have more than 50 role instances per deployment.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can't have more than 50 role instances per deployment.

trans-unit.source: See [Run an Azure Application in the Compute Emulator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623050)
trans-unit.target: See [Run an Azure Application in the Compute Emulator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623050)

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Debugging Cloud Services
